place.name: EDGEWORTH
place.gazetteerText: EDGEWORTH, a parish in Cirencester district, Gloucester; near Ermine-street, 3½ miles NE of Brimscombe r. station, and 5½ NW of Cirencester. Post town, Bisley, under Stroud. Acres, 1, 566. Real property, £1, 734. Pop., 139. Houses, 28. The property is divided among a few. The surface is hilly. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £321.* Patron, the Rev. G. F. E. Shaw. The church has Norman traces, and is good. Charities, £6. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
